Method Detail

createNoArgConstructorClassInstance

public static java.lang.Object createNoArgConstructorClassInstance(java.lang.String className)
Creates a class instance from a string of the full class name including packages. This is how you dynamically make objects at runtime if you don't know which\ class beforehand. For example, if you wanted to create a BJF_1997_IMR you can do it the normal way:

BJF_1997_IMR imr = new BJF_1997_IMR()

If your not sure the user wants this one or AS_1997_IMR you can use this function instead to create the same class by:

BJF_1997_IMR imr = (BJF_1997_IMR)ClassUtils.createNoArgConstructorClassInstance("org.scec.sha.imt.classicImpl.BJF_1997_IMR");

isEmptyString

public static boolean isEmptyString(java.lang.String val)
Checks that a string is not null, or not equal to empty string ""
